page.title: 01SCREMERSTON.
page.content: {SCREMERSTON}is a small village in {North Northumberland}situated about two miles south of the historic border town of Berwick-upon-Tweed.The A1 trunk road used to pass through the centre of the of the village but in 1983 a bypass was completed and now only local traffic use the former busy trunk route. The area is mainly arable farmland, sheep and cattle are grazed and the crops grown are barley,wheat and oats. To the east of the area is the main East Coast railway line linking{London and{Edinburgh}and still further east is the North Sea.Up to about the 1950s there were very few houses in the village but after that some housing development took place when the local Council built about 70 houses.Twenty four flats for old people were built as part of a sheltered housing scheme.
